info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 4:16AM EDT until April 6 at 4:45AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
Big Walnut Creek near Reelsville.
White Lick Creek at Mooresville.
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Indiana...
Sugar Creek at New Palestine.
.Additional widespread heavy rainfall Friday night has led to Minor to Moderate Flooding on several streams and creeks across central Indiana. Flooding will crest on most creeks later today and recede through minor flood later this weekend.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White Lick Creek at Mooresville.
* WHEN...From early this morning to late tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 20.8 feet, During June 2010 flood...additional roads flooded included...in Hendricks County...CR 600E about one half mile north of CR 300N, south entrance to Indiana's Boy School from CR 700E, CR 725 E near CR 600S, and in Morgan County...Bottom Road south of Brooklyn.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 17.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 AM EDT Saturday was 17.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 730 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE TONIGHT
